Now that the Myreque freedom fighters' base camp has been revealed, they'll need to move on and set up base somewhere else. Veliaf has heard of a little known village south of Mort'ton, referred to as 'Burgh de Rott'. This could be just the place to set up operations to strike back against the evil of Lowerniel Vergidiyad Drakan and his Vampyric overlordship in Morytania. And who knows what other secrets about Morytania and its dark past will be revealed?
AIDOFMYREQUE.startPoint: Go to [Canifis](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Canifis) and down the ladder behind the pub there, through the secret wall and squeeze past the stalagmite on the east side of the cave. Speak to [Veliaf](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Veliaf_Hurtz).
trivia: None

KINGSRANSOM.name: King's Ransom
KINGSRANSOM.description: Life has been quiet at the Sinclair Mansion since you discovered the murderer... too quiet. So quiet, in fact, that the family has gone! Suspicions are running high that the Sinclairs' recent departure is tied to the disappearance of King Arthur and his knights. But time is running short and clues are scarce, will you crack the case in time?
trivia: When the quest was introduced in [RuneScape 2](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/RuneScape_2), the [Party Room](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Party_Room) was moved from [Seers' Village](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Seers%27_Village) to [Falador](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Falador) to make room for the [courthouse](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Courthouse).

When finding [Anna](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Anna) not guilty, 'Party Balloons' fall down. This is because of the Party Room being here previously, as stated by the judge when talking to him after the acquittal.
If you talk to [Merlin](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Merlin) after the quest, he will give you a [hair clip](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Hair_clip) as a memory of the adventure.

When in jail, one of the knights is playing with a baseball; its a reference to the movie, [The Great Escape](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Great_Escape) with [Steve McQueen](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steve_McQueen).
When the Knights of the Round Table die in battle at [Keep Le Faye](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Keep_Le_Faye), they simply respawn where they were killed.

When discussing with Merlin how to escape, your character asks if he's going to turn everyone into fish and swim out. This is a reference to the 1963 Disney animated movie, [The Sword in the Stone](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sword_in_the_Stone_(film)).

King's Ransom quest is the 'newest' quest on [Old School RuneScape](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Old_School_RuneScape), not counting quests exclusively released on Old School. It was the last quest released (at July 2007) before the back-up from which Old School RuneScape was built upon was taken (August 2007).

Despite the 65 [Defence](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Defence) requirement not being boostable, if the quest hasn't been started and the player boosts to 65 Defence, the quest log will show the requirement as being met.

SEARCHOFMYREQUE.name: In Search of the Myreque
SEARCHOFMYREQUE.description: Canifis is experiencing an upsurge in new faces and a new stranger has appeared with a job to track down some local heroes known only as 'The Myreque'. The Myreque are fighting a desperate battle against the darkness of Morytania and he wishes to take them weapons to aid in the battle. Can you help him out?
trivia: None

LEGENDSQUEST.name: Legends' Quest
LEGENDSQUEST.description: Only the elite are allowed to call themselves a Legend of RuneScape. Do you have what it takes to make it into the guild?
LEGENDSQUEST.startPoint: Talk to the guards just outside of the [Legends' Guild](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Legends%27_Guild).
rewards: Access to the [Legends' Guild](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Legends%27_Guild) (including shop to buy the [cape of legends](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Cape_of_legends))

7,650 XP each in four skills of your choice (limited to [Attack](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Attack), [Defence](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Defence), [Strength](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Strength), [Hitpoints](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Hitpoints), [Prayer](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Prayer), [Magic](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Magic), [Woodcutting](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Woodcutting), [Crafting](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Crafting), [Smithing](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Smithing), [Herblore](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Herblore), [Agility](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Agility), [Thieving](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Thieving). It is possible to choose the same skill several times).

Ability to charge your [Skills necklace](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Skills_necklace) or [Combat bracelet](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Combat_bracelet) at the [Legends' Guild](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Legends%27_Guild) or the [Fountain of Rune](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Fountain_of_Rune).
Access to the [Kharazi Jungle](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Kharazi_Jungle) and a vine shortcut into it, requiring 79 [Agility](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Agility).
requirements: Ability to defeat a level 187 demon
trivia: None

TARN.name: Lair of Tarn Razorlor
TARN.description: This miniquest is to kill [Tarn Razorlor](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Tarn_Razorlor) and retrieve his diary. Using his diary on a [salve amulet](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Salve_amulet) will enchant it increasing its attack and strength bonuses by 5%.
TARN.startPoint: Enter the Lair of Tarn Razorlor.
trivia: None

LOSTCITY.name: Lost City
LOSTCITY.description: Can you find the legendary lost city of [Zanaris](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Zanaris)?
LOSTCITY.startPoint: Go to [Lumbridge Swamp](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Lumbridge_Swamp). Talk to the campers there.
requirements: Ability to kill a level 101 [Tree spirit](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Tree_spirit_(Lost_City)) with limited [armour](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Armour) and [weapons](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Weapons).
trivia: None

LUNARDIPLOMACY.name: Lunar Diplomacy
LUNARDIPLOMACY.description: Can you make it to Moonclan Island and make peace between the Moonclan and the Fremenniks?
LUNARDIPLOMACY.startPoint: Go to the westernmost dock of [Rellekka](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Rellekka), and talk to [Lokar](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Lokar_Searunner).
requirements: Ability to kill multiple level 111 monsters

Ability to access the [Air](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Air_altar), [Earth](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Earth_altar), [Fire](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Fire_altar) and [Water](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Water_altar) [Runecrafting](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Runecrafting) altars
trivia: After you give [Meteora](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Meteora) her Special Tiara, she still seems to be wearing the [Lunar amulet](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Lunar_amulet) on her head on her chathead and in-game.

[Baba Yaga](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Baba_Yaga) and her walking chicken house is a reference to [Quest for Glory I](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quest_for_Glory:_So_You_Want_to_Be_a_Hero) by [Sierra Entertainment](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sierra_Entertainment). In fact, the name Baba Yaga comes from a character in Russian folklore, who is an old witch that lives in a house with chicken legs.

The player says, 'Oh captain, my captain,' on the third time speaking to [Captain Bentley](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Captain_Bentley)); it's a reference to the poem by [Walt Whitman](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walt_Whitman), [O Captain! My Captain!](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/O_Captain!_My_Captain!). The poem pays tribute to Abraham Lincoln and was written in 1865. The phrase was also used in Dead Poets Society upon the dismissal of the English teacher, John Keating.

During the dialogue between Captain Bentley and the player when the player asks the Captain Bentley about his ship named the [Lady Zay](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Lady_Zay)', the player mentions that they used to own a ship named the [Lady Lumbridge](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Lady_Lumbridge)', which is a reference to [Dragon Slayer](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Dragon_Slayer).

Captain Bentley also tells the player that he stole his ship from the Karamjan shipyards, and that he doesn't know who they were building that kind of warships, but whoever it was seemed to be a little on the short side. This is a reference to the quest, [The Grand Tree](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/The_Grand_Tree), in which the Karamjan warships were built for gnomes.
Also while talking to Captain Bentley, at one part his parrot says, 'I want guns, lots of guns!', which is a quote from the movie, [The Matrix](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Matrix).
'Birds-Eye' Jack is likely a reference to the popular british frozen food range Birds Eye. That features a pirate as it's mascot.

Before you enter the dream, if you re-obtain the [kindling](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Kindling) and [potion](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Waking_sleep_vial) from the [Oneiromancer](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Oneiromancer) and then soak the kindling and drop it, you are left with an [empty lunar vial](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Empty_vial)); you can fill this up with water again and mix in a [guam leaf](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Guam_leaf) and a [marrentill](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Marrentill) once more for 84 [Herblore](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Herblore) XP per herb, though you cannot empty out the [vials](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Guam-marr_vial). Unfortunately, getting more vials requires passing through tedious dialogue. It is not known whether this is a bug.

Examining the log piles in the [Dream World](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Dream_World) [Woodcutting](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Woodcutting) challenge yields the message 'Like a pile of memes'.
On Captain Bentley's ship there is a crew member called [Tommy 2-times](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Tommy_2-times). This could be a reference to the movie Goodfella's "Jimmy Two-Times".
When speaking to Selene about her archaeologist grandfather's ring, she mentions 'dodging boulders and piles of snakes' to find his hidden treasures. This is a reference to the Indiana Jones movies.

MAKINGHISTORY.name: Making History
MAKINGHISTORY.description: A secluded outpost has served the City of Ardougne for generations, playing stage to many exceptional events. Its current occupant wants to employ your skills to construct its true history before time runs out and history itself is wiped away!
MAKINGHISTORY.startPoint: Talk to [Jorral](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Jorral) in the [outpost](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Outpost) north-west of [West](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/West_Ardougne) [Ardougne](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ardougne).
trivia: If you visit [Droalak](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Droalak) after the quest, the player's character will tell him that they have delivered the scroll and it was of good use. Droalak finally rests in peace.

When the quest is completed, [Jorral](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Jorral) will tell you there is something that may interest you in his museum. If you search the bookcase and choose the book titled 'The Mysterious Adventurer', it will be a book written about your character, telling you stories of some of your completed quests.
Jorral's quote 'Do you want to know more?' at the beginning of the quest is a reference to a repeated line in the 1997 film Starship Troopers.

MERLINSCRYSTAL.name: Merlin's Crystal
MERLINSCRYSTAL.description: The wizard [Merlin](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Merlin) has been trapped in a magical crystal by the witch [Morgan Le Faye](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Morgan_Le_Faye). So far, King Arthur hasn't been able to figure out how to free his mentor from his crystal prison. Can you help?
requirements: Ability to defeat a level 39 enemy.
trivia: Merlin's Crystal gives six [quest points](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Quest_points), the most of any single quest (other than the compound quest, [Recipe for Disaster](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Recipe_for_Disaster)), despite being relatively easy.

MONKSFRIEND.name: Monk's Friend
MONKSFRIEND.description: A monk's child has had their blanket stolen. Find the thieves' den and return the blanket, then help Brother Omad organize the drinks for the child's birthday party.
MONKSFRIEND.startPoint: Speak to [Brother Omad](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Brother_Omad) at the [monastery](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ardougne_Monastery) south of [Ardougne](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ardougne).
trivia: None

MONKEYMADNESSII.name: Monkey Madness II
MONKEYMADNESSII.description: Glough, the war criminal set on eradicating humans and overthrowing Gielinor, has escaped the watch of the Grand Tree gnomes. With a history of leaving large-scale conflicts and warfare in his wake, Glough must be tracked down and stopped. King Narnode Shareen needs your help.
rewards: Ability to communicate with monkeys in [Ape Atoll](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ape_Atoll) without the [M'speak amulet](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/M%27speak_amulet).
Access to [Ape Atoll](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ape_Atoll) without the use of [Monkey greegrees](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Monkey_greegree).
Access to new glider spot directly to Ape Atoll.

2x 50,000 XP rewards from [Duke](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Duke) in your choice of [Magic](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Magic), [Ranged](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ranged), [Attack](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Attack), [Defence](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Defence), [Strength](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Strength) or [Hitpoints](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Hitpoints). Found on the hill east of main gate of Ape Atoll. (Walk up west hill, and climb the ladder to reach the east hill.)

A [Royal seed pod](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Royal_seed_pod), which provides unlimited teleports to the [Grand Tree](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Grand_Tree) (Up to level 30 wilderness).
A [Monkey](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Monkey_(Monkey_Madness_II)) can be found in one of the crates at the Crash Site. It is purely cosmetic and can be equipped in the cape slot.

Ability to re-fight [Glough](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Glough) by gazing into the [Burning brazier](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Burning_brazier) in [Zooknocks](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Zooknock) house.

Access to a new [maniacal monkey](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Maniacal_monkey_(Hunter)) hunting area where Glough's laboratory used to be in [Kruk's Dungeon](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Kruk%27s_Dungeon).
requirements: [Enlightened Journey](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Enlightened_Journey) (including unlocking the [Grand Tree](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Grand_Tree) destination for the [Balloon transport system](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Balloon_transport_system#Grand_Tree), requiring 60 [Firemaking](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Firemaking))
trivia: None

MONKEYMADNESS.name: Monkey Madness
MONKEYMADNESS.description: The King of the northern Gnomes, Narnode Shareen, is once again in need of your help. He recently decided to send an envoy of his Royal Guard, the 10th squad, to oversee the decommissioning of the Gnome owned ship-building facilities on the eastern coast of [Karamja](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Karamja). It has been quite some time since the 10th squad were dispatched and they have been deemed missing in action. It will be up to you, should you decide to help, to find out what fate befell the 10th squad and if possible, track them down. If only it were so simple. Sinister forces have begun to spread through the Gnome hierarchy and threaten to unleash an unknown terror upon the world. Far across the land, the fires of vengeance are being stoked once again. Can you unravel the mystery behind the deception? Can you separate the truth from the lies? Can you decide for yourself what is real and what is not?
rewards: Gain 35,000 XP in [Attack](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Attack) and [Defence](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Defence), or [Strength](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Strength) and [Hitpoints](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Hitpoints), and then 20,000 experience in the other option, by speaking to [Daero](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Daero). Note for 1-Defence pures: You cannot go back to the bunker (and thus back to [Ape Atoll](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ape_Atoll)) without speaking to Daero and gaining Defence XP. The only way to return to Ape Atoll as a pure is if you stop the quest after killing the Jungle Demon. Do not talk to Daero.

Note for 1-Defence pures: You cannot go back to the bunker (and thus back to [Ape Atoll](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ape_Atoll)) without speaking to Daero and gaining Defence XP. The only way to return to Ape Atoll as a pure is if you stop the quest after killing the Jungle Demon. Do not talk to Daero.
Ability to buy and wield the [Dragon scimitar](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Dragon_scimitar).
Ability to turn into a monkey, in Ape Atoll & [Ardougne Zoo](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ardougne_Zoo), using the [Monkey greegree](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Monkey_greegree).
Full access to Ape Atoll. (Bank is unlocked after [Monkey Madness II](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Monkey_Madness_II).)
requirements: 43+ [Prayer](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Prayer) HIGHLY RECOMMENDED, as the player will be attacked by numerous hard-hitting melee enemies in multicombat
trivia: If you talk to [Zeke](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Zeke), the scimitar seller of [Al Kharid](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Al_Kharid), and ask him for a [Dragon scimitar](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Dragon_scimitar), he will respond, "The banana-brained nitwits who make them would never sell any to me. Seriously, you'll be a monkey's uncle before you hold a Dragon Scimitar." Obviously, this is a reference to this quest.

If you have started [Fairytale II - Cure a Queen](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Fairytale_II_-_Cure_a_Queen), you can use a new [fairy ring](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Fairy_ring) location on Ape Atoll. Using this fairy ring requires completion of Daero's training. In order to leave the small area where the fairy ring is located, you will need a [ninja greegree](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ninja_greegree) and 48 [Agility](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Agility) to continue through the remainder of the agility course.
If you tell [Zooknock](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Zooknock) you lost the amulet, you will have to get the materials to create a new one.

If you wear a [M'speak amulet](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/M%27speak_amulet) and listen to the [enchanted bar](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Enchanted_bar), it says "I'm stuck in this horrible gold bar!"
The chapter cards and cut scenes in this quest are references to the adventure game series Monkey Island.

Upon first talking to [Awowogei](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Awowogei), [Uwogo](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Uwogo) says to 'never trust a Northern monkey'. This is in reference to the friendly rivalry between the North and the South within the UK (Northern Monkeys, Southern Fairies).

MISTHALINMYSTERY.name: Misthalin Mystery
MISTHALINMYSTERY.description: A woman cries as a man lays dying, desperately they beg you to stop a cryptic killer before their friends suffer a similar fate.
MISTHALINMYSTERY.startPoint: [Lumbridge Swamp](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Lumbridge_Swamp), south-east near the [fishing spots](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Fishing_spots), speak to [Abigale](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Abigale) (or [Hewey](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Hewey), who sits next to her).
trivia: This quest was originally released as the [2016 Hallowe'en event](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/2016_Hallowe%27en_event), but was later released as a permanent quest after passing a poll.

Players initially did not receive 600 [Crafting](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Crafting) XP upon completing the quest. Players who completed the quest before the reward was added were told to speak with [Mandy](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Mandy) outside the Mansion to receive the additional reward.
The mansion in this quest is based on [Draynor Manor](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Draynor_Manor).
No music plays at all during the quest. If you were to travel to the island and then log out and back in, you would find that your music player is playing nothing at all.
This quest is based on the movie Scream, particularly when the Killer asks "What is your favorite scary quest?". 'Quest' is used instead of 'Movie'.

MOUNTAINDAUGHTER.name: Mountain Daughter
MOUNTAINDAUGHTER.description: Ages ago, a small tribe of people split off from the Fremennik in Rellekka and decided to inhabit the mountains to the east of town. There they lived as nomads for many years, but now the chieftain of the camp has lost his daughter and will not move on before she has been found. Has she run away, has she been eaten by trolls, or is there something more sinister going on? Only you can find out.
MOUNTAINDAUGHTER.startPoint: Talk to [Hamal the Chieftain](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Hamal_the_Chieftain) in the [Mountain Camp](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Mountain_Camp) east of [Rellekka](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Rellekka). To get in, take the path north of the [Golden Apple Tree](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Golden_Apple_Tree) and use a [rope](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Rope) on the rock behind the guard (see below for more details).
trivia: When you complete the quest, instead of hearing the normal quest complete music, the game plays Asleif's singing and you receive a message saying "You think you can hear a soft 'thank you' as the singing quietens down."

If you have completed the [Throne of Miscellania](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Throne_of_Miscellania) quest and challenge [Ragnar](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ragnar), he will mention that perhaps you will understand why he has waited 14 years with the necklace when you find your love, and your character will reply 'I already have a marriage lined up, thanks', rolling his/her eyes.

The examine text for the guard in front of the ancient rock tent is 'He seems to be guarding a single rock. Interesting job.' while the text for the guard by the rockslide is 'He seems to be guarding a pile of rocks. Interesting job.

When you 'pull on the rope and miraculously. it comes loose', it is likely a reference to when [Samwise Gamgee](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samwise_Gamgee) pulls elven rope loose from a knot with one small pull in [The Lord of the Rings](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lord_of_the_Rings).

[The Kendal](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/The_Kendal) resembles, in both name and appearance, the monster [Grendel](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grendel) from the famous old English poem [Beowulf](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beowulf).
When you first talk to The Kendal, he quotes the Cave of Wonders guardian from [Aladdin](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aladdin_(1992_Disney_film)), 'Who dares disturb my slumber?'

When talking to The Kendal, you can ask him what he is doing in 'that stupid bear suit', to which he will respond with the question 'What are you doing in that stupid set of armor?'. This is a reference to the movie [Donnie Darko](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donnie_Darko).

MOURNINGSENDPARTI.name: Mourning's Ends Part I
MOURNINGSENDPARTI.description: It seems at last Arianwyn has need of your skills. He believes there is more to the Mourners than meets the eye and he wishes for you to find out just what they're up to. Can you gain the trust of the Mourners?
MOURNINGSENDPARTI.startPoint: In the Isafdar Woods, where the Roving Elves are (outside Tyras Camp and in the southeast corner of the woods). Speak to Eluned.
trivia: None

MURDERMYSTERY.name: Murder Mystery
MURDERMYSTERY.description: Old man Sinclair has been found dead in his mansion! Unfortunately, the local authorities are having some trouble figuring out who's the guilty party. Maybe the unbiased eye of a passing adventurer will be of help.
MURDERMYSTERY.startPoint: The [Sinclair Mansion](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Sinclair_Mansion), north along the path between [Seers' Village](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Seers%27_Village) and [Camelot](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Camelot). Talk to one of the guards around the mansion.
trivia: None

MOURNINGSENDPARTII.name: Mourning's Ends Part II
MOURNINGSENDPARTII.description: This chapter of the quest takes our hero deep under the mountains of Arandar to put a stop to the evil plans of the mourners. If our hero is to succeed, they must solve one of the most complicated puzzles in all of Gielinor.
rewards: A [crystal trinket](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Crystal_trinket) (allows you access to the [Temple of Light](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Temple_of_Light))

A [death talisman](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Death_talisman), and the ability to craft [death runes](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Death_runes) (you'll get full access to the abyssal rift as well)
requirements: 60+ [Agility](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Agility) for lesser chances of failing obstacles (91 to never fail [[1]](#cite_note-0))
trivia: None

NATURESPIRIT.name: Nature Spirit
NATURESPIRIT.description: After saving the holy man Drezel, he's seeking some assistance again. This time he has a special request for any adventurous sorts to search for the Druid 'Filliman Tarlock' and brave the terrors that infest the swamp of Mort Myre.
NATURESPIRIT.startPoint: Speak to [Drezel](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Drezel) under the Saradomin temple near the [River Salve](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/River_Salve).
trivia: None

MYARM.name: My Arm's Big Adventure
MYARM.description: Trolls love goutweed. They love it so much that they've picked it all, and now they can't get any more. However, in his smelly kitchen in the Troll Stronghold, Burntmeat the cook has heard a rumour that goutweed is growing once again, for anyone who's got the skill to farm it. Can you teach his young assistant - a simple troll known as My Arm - to grow the precious goutweed? Will you overcome My Arm's stubbornness and ignorance to earn yourself Burntmeat's reward? Dare you accompany My Arm on this uniquely trollish expedition?
MYARM.startPoint: The kitchen, deep in the [Troll Stronghold](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Troll_Stronghold_(area)). Talk to [Burntmeat](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Burntmeat).
rewards: Access to a disease-free herb patch on top of the [Troll Stronghold](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Troll_Stronghold_(area)).
requirements: At least 60% favour in the [Tai Bwo Wannai Cleanup](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Tai_Bwo_Wannai_Cleanup) [minigame](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Minigames) - must be acquired BEFORE starting this quest (it will be subtracted from total).

43 [Prayer](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Prayer) ([Protect from Melee](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Protect_from_Melee) could negate damage from [mountain trolls](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Mountain_troll) and [Protect from Missiles](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Protect_from_Missiles) along the [Death Plateau](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Death_Plateau_(location)) route.)
trivia: If you have a [gout tuber](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Gout_tuber) in your [bank](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Bank) or [inventory](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Inventory) when first talking to [My Arm](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/My_Arm), you will attempt to offer it instead of going to [Death Plateau](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Death_Plateau_(location)). However, My Arm is very stubborn and refuses.
Depending where your [house](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Player-owned_house) is, your character will reference its location and tells My Arm that he's never coming over.

If during the part of the quest where he shows you his farming patch you already have the [Ugthanki dung](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ugthanki_dung) in your inventory, he will point out that you stink.

[Qutiedoll](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Qutiedoll) made his second appearance after the [Draynor Bank Robbery](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Draynor_Bank_Robbery) during the Rumble in the Jungle [cutscene](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Cutscene) when he was attacked by My Arm.

During a cutscene, My Arm throws the [Drunken Dwarf](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Drunken_Dwarf) off the roof of the [Troll Stronghold](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Troll_Stronghold_(area)) and an unnamed young troll comes up to him. After the quest, the troll's name has changed to [Drunken dwarf's leg](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Drunken_dwarf%27s_leg).

During the first cutscene, if you try to take any of the [items](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Items) on the floor, the cutscene will stop and [Burntmeat](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Burntmeat) will tell you to start paying attention.

If you have completed the [Swan Song](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Swan_Song) [quest](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Quests) and ask for the [Dragon items](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Dragon_(metal)) as your reward just after the first cutscene, you will complain that this is just like the [Wise Old Man](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Wise_Old_Man) not giving you his [blue partyhat](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Blue_partyhat) at the end of the quest.

OBSERVATORYQUEST.name: Observatory Quest
OBSERVATORYQUEST.description: The Observatory in south-west Ardougne has been ransacked by a family of nearby goblins. Can you help the professor to rebuild it?
OBSERVATORYQUEST.startPoint: Talk to the [Observatory professor](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Observatory_professor) in the [Observatory](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Observatory) Reception Room south-west of [Ardougne](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ardougne), north of [Castle Wars](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Castle_Wars).
rewards: Your item reward depends on what astrological sign you see when you look through the Telescope. It is also different for each person. You will get one of these: A [maple longbow](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Maple_longbow) [Weapon poison](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Weapon_poison) 3 [Law runes](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Law_rune) An [amulet of defence](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Amulet_of_defence) A [black 2h sword](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Black_2h_sword) A 1-dose [super strength](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Super_strength) potion 25 [Water runes](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Water_rune) 3 [Tuna](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Tuna) An [uncut sapphire](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Uncut_sapphire) 875 Experience in [Attack](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Attack), [Defence](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Defence), [Hitpoints](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Hitpoints), or [Strength](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Strength) (random)

The [Spirit of Scorpius](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Spirit_of_Scorpius) will now give you a [mould](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Unholy_mould) to make [Unholy symbols](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Unholy_symbol), and he will bless them for you too. He can be found in the graveyard north of the [Observatory](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Observatory).

Talk to the [Observatory assistant](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Observatory_assistant) after the [quest](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Quests) and he will reward you with a [jug of wine](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Jug_of_wine) as well as tell you his and the professor's real name.
requirements: Ability to defeat a level 42 monster.
trivia: None

OLAFSQUEST.name: Olaf's Quest
OLAFSQUEST.description: Poor Olaf Hradson. He has to live up to such expectations. His ancestors sailed all over the world, and now he has to go out and prove himself their equal. If only he could read a map... If only he could sail... If only he hadn't crashed! Can you help a depressed and soggy Fremennik regain his pride, and possibly the lost treasure of his grandfather?
OLAFSQUEST.startPoint: The mouth of the [Fremennik](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Fremennik) [hunting area](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Rellekka_Hunter_area). Talk to [Olaf Hradson](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Olaf_Hradson).
rewards: Access to a cave where you can fight [brine rats](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Brine_rat).
A piece of [parchment](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Parchment_(Olaf%27s_Quest)) telling you of other shipwrecks with more treasure.
requirements: Ability to defeat a level 100 monster
trivia: When the quest was first released, the slippery bridge towards the end of the quest was considered by many players to be too difficult, and [Jagex](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Jagex) received many complaints. The next day, they issued a fix that made it slightly easier to cross the bridge after each failed attempt.

When you examine the boulder that you can roll once in the [Brine Rat Cavern](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Brine_Rat_Cavern), the text is a reference to the game show, [Family Feud](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family_Feud).

ONESMALLFAVOUR.name: One Small Favour
ONESMALLFAVOUR.description: If you're fresh to [Shilo Village](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Shilo_Village) after solving the mystery (or even if you did it some time ago), you may like to check out Yanni Salika's antiques shop. He's a busy chap revamping antique items, checking out new stock from potential adventurers and maybe he'll have a small1 favour to ask of you? Probably nothing particularly large, Yanni isn't a demanding2 person, should hardly take you any time3 at all really, something to do when you have a spare moment. That's assuming there aren't any complications. 1: - Perception of the word "small" may be open to interpretation. 2: - In a recent vote, Yanni Salika was only voted the second most demanding person in Shilo Village. 3: - As everyone knows, time is relative.
rewards: Two experience lamps giving 10,000 XP to any skill of your choice. Skill must be at least level 30.
Access to the [gnome glider](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Gnome_glider) route to the [Feldip Hills](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Feldip_Hills)
trivia: Hammerspike Stoutbeard's desire to be a druid may stem from Pikel Bouldershoulder, a dwarf druid from several of R.A. Salvatore's books.[[3]](#cite_note-2)

PIRATESTREASURE.name: Pirate's Treasure
PIRATESTREASURE.description: [Redbeard Frank](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Redbeard_Frank) knows the location of pirate treasure, but he'll only part with the knowledge for a bottle of Karamja rum.
PIRATESTREASURE.startPoint: The northernmost dock at [Port Sarim](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Port_Sarim), just south of the [pub](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/The_Rusty_Anchor).
trivia: When the quest was first released, the [Karamja rum](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Karamja_rum) were tradeable and the bottles would not break if players tried to teleport. Some players simply bought a whole load of rum and sold it to players doing the quest, allowing them to skip a large part of it. When this was posted on fan forums, a Jagex developer saw it and the problem was soon corrected.

PRIESTINPERIL.name: Priest in Peril
PRIESTINPERIL.description: Recently contact has been lost with the temple to Saradomin on Misthalins' Eastern border. [King Roald](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/King_Roald) would be very interested to know what has caused this lack of communication, and seeks an adventurer willing to report back to him on the situation.
rewards: [Wolfbane](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Wolfbane) (when fighting [werewolves](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Werewolf) in [Morytania](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Morytania), this will stop them from changing into their more powerful werewolf form if the dagger is equipped).
requirements: Ability to defeat a [combat level](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Combat_level) 30 enemy without [Magic](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Magic).
trivia: Drezel will appear in the Mausoleum before he escapes his cell, but is unreachable until he is freed.

If you have a clue scroll which requires speaking with Drezel before you have met him in the Mausoleum, talking to him in the Mausoleum will trigger the clue scroll prior to proceeding with the quest.

PLAGUECITY.name: Plague City
PLAGUECITY.description: The western part of Ardougne has been shut off as a deadly plague sweeps through the people. However, a young woman who went in to try to help those stricken by the illness has disappeared and her parents have become worried.
PLAGUECITY.startPoint: Talk to [Edmond](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Edmond), living next to the wall surrounding [East Ardougne](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/East_Ardougne), north of the [castle](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ardougne_Castle).
rewards: [A magic scroll](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/A_magic_scroll), letting you use the [Ardougne Teleport](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ardougne_Teleport) if your [Magic](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Magic) level is 51 or above. After you read it, you'll memorise the spell. Usage of an [Ardougne teletab](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ardougne_teleport) also requires the completion of this quest.
trivia: None

PRINCEALIRESCUE.name: Prince Ali Rescue
PRINCEALIRESCUE.description: Prince Ali of Al Kharid has been kidnapped by the scheming Lady Keli. You are hired to stage a rescue mission.
PRINCEALIRESCUE.startPoint: Speak to [Hassan](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Hassan) in the palace at [Al Kharid](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Al_Kharid).
rewards: Free passage through the Al Kharid gate
trivia: None

QUEENOFTHIEVES.name: The Queen of Thieves
QUEENOFTHIEVES.description: The gangs of Kourend have recently been uniting under a mysterious figure called the Queen of Thieves, somewhere in Port Piscarilius. This novice quest tasks the player with infiltrating the gangs of Kourend in order to find the Queen of Thieves.
rewards: [Piscarilius favour certificate](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Piscarilius_favour_certificate). Reading it grants 10% Piscarilius favour. It is suggested to abstain from doing so if you are progressing towards locking the favour of other houses.

A page for [Kharedst's memoirs](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Kharedst%27s_memoirs), ['The fisher's flute.'](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/The_fisher%27s_flute) It teleports players to the centre of the Piscarilius House.
trivia: If players already have a stew in their inventory upon talking to Robert O'Reilly, both will mention how convenient it is that the player has it. This is likely a reference to players who look up quest guides beforehand.

When killing Conrad King, there is a chance he will say the line, 'I'm coming Elizabeth!', which is a reference to the television comedy [Sanford and Son](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sanford_and_Son). In the series, the show's namesake, Fred Sanford, routinely feigns illness and shouts a line similar to that of Conrad King. (It is also possible for Conrad King to merely shout 'Here I go!')

WISHLIST.name: Rag & Bone Wish List
requirements: 20 [Defence](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Defence) Note: 20 [Defence](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Defence) is required to wield the [mirror shield](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Mirror_shield), which is needed to kill [Basilisks](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Basilisk). HOWEVER, it is still possible to kill Basilisks with the use of [poison](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Poison) and multiple [Rings of Recoil](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ring_of_recoil). There is also a [safe spot](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Safe_spot) that a Basilisk can be ranged over across some rocks in the [Fremennik Slayer Dungeon](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Fremennik_Slayer_Dungeon). An easy way to get the bone would require two accounts. One wears to wear recoil and the other to cast Vengeance Other spell. While waiting for the Vengeance Other spell, the account with recoils can equip a mirror shield and unequip shield for vengeance. Note: Dark Bow spec with dragon arrows is a guaranteed hit when basilisk is below 16 hp.

Note: 20 [Defence](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Defence) is required to wield the [mirror shield](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Mirror_shield), which is needed to kill [Basilisks](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Basilisk). HOWEVER, it is still possible to kill Basilisks with the use of [poison](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Poison) and multiple [Rings of Recoil](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ring_of_recoil). There is also a [safe spot](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Safe_spot) that a Basilisk can be ranged over across some rocks in the [Fremennik Slayer Dungeon](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Fremennik_Slayer_Dungeon). An easy way to get the bone would require two accounts. One wears to wear recoil and the other to cast Vengeance Other spell. While waiting for the Vengeance Other spell, the account with recoils can equip a mirror shield and unequip shield for vengeance. Note: Dark Bow spec with dragon arrows is a guaranteed hit when basilisk is below 16 hp.

Completed [The Fremennik Trials](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/The_Fremennik_Trials), [Horror from the Deep](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Horror_from_the_Deep) and [Waterfall Quest](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Waterfall_Quest) (Waterfall Quest and The Fremennik Trials being optional)
Ability to kill several high-level monsters
trivia: None

RAGANDBONEMAN.name: Rag and Bone Man
RAGANDBONEMAN.description: Everybody needs some body, and the Odd Old Man knows exactly which bits of those bodies he needs. Can you help him finish his extensive and extremely creepy collection?
RAGANDBONEMAN.startPoint: Go east of [Varrock](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Varrock), through the gate near the earth altar, to [Paterdomus](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Paterdomus). The old man is in a little quarry just north of the path.
requirements: Ability to defeat a level 27 monster.
trivia: Rag-and-bone man is a British phrase for a junk dealer. Historically, the phrase referred to an individual who would travel the streets of a city with a horsedrawn cart, and would collect old rags, (for converting into fabric and paper), bones for making glue, scrap iron and other items, often trading them for other items of limited value.

RATCATCHERS.name: Ratcatchers
RATCATCHERS.length: Long - Very long (Preparing items and teleports ahead of time will save a significant amount of time. A [cat](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Cat) saves you a lot of time too!)
RATCATCHERS.description: Gertrude knows of some ratcatchers in Varrock, pay her a visit and she may tell you of their whereabouts. Perhaps they could show you and your cat a few pointers about rat catching. Enter the subterranean world of the rat catchers and discover more of your cats true potential.
rewards: Ability to train overgrown cats into [wily](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Wily_cat) and lazy cats.
Ability to name your wily or lazy [cat](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Cat) (up to six letters long).

Ability to use the [Minigame Teleport](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Minigame_Group_Finder) to the rat pits in [Port Sarim](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Port_Sarim), [Ardougne](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Ardougne), [Varrock](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Varrock), and [Keldagrim](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Keldagrim).
trivia: Just before your [cat](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Cat) kills the smoked out mice in [Keldagrim](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Keldagrim), it will say 'Exterminate! Exterminate!', which is a reference to the [Daleks](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daleks) in the British science fiction show, [Doctor Who](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doctor_Who).

Some [guards](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Guard) in the garden will say I miss Billy and Bob *sigh*. This is a reference to the guards killed during the cutscene of the [Garden of Tranquillity](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Garden_of_Tranquillity) quest, where you were stealing the statue of the king. It doesn't matter if you have started the quest or not.

REGICIDE.name: Regicide
REGICIDE.description: Continuing the Plague City series, the Regicide Quest takes you beyond the 'Well of Voyage' to a new realm. King Lathas will employ you once again, this time for the grim task of disposing of his brother. Upon travelling to the realm you will find yourself surrounded by new and strange plants, animals and even a new race. Once there, you will see that everything is not as serene as it first appears.
REGICIDE.startPoint: [King Lathas](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/King_Lathas) will send a messenger to you (similar to a [random event](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Random_events), and typically occurs within 30 minutes of completing [Underground Pass](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Underground_Pass), though some players have had to wait hours)
rewards: Access to the elven kingdom of [Tirannwn](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Tirannwn) and the overpass of [Arandar](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Arandar)
Access to the [dragon halberd](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Dragon_halberd) (325,000 coins at the [Tyras Camp](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Tyras_Camp))
Ability to use [Zul-andra teleport scrolls](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Zul-andra_teleport) and kill [Zulrah](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Zulrah)
requirements: 10 [Crafting](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Crafting) (To make the strip of cloth. It is tradeable, but can't be traded on the [Grand Exchange](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Grand_Exchange), so if you want it without 10 Crafting you have to ask a friend to make one for you.)
Ability to defeat a level 110 [Tyras Guard](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Tyras_Guard). ([Safespots](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Safespots) are available.)
trivia: None

RESTLESSGHOST.name: The Restless Ghost
RESTLESSGHOST.description: A ghost is haunting [Lumbridge](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Lumbridge) graveyard. The priest of the [Lumbridge](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Lumbridge) church of [Saradomin](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Saradomin) wants you to find out how to get rid of it.
RESTLESSGHOST.startPoint: The church in [Lumbridge](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Lumbridge), to the south-east of [Lumbridge Castle](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Lumbridge_Castle). Inside, talk to the Father Aereck.
trivia: The Restless Ghost is one of 6 quests released on the launch day of RuneScape.
You can understand the ghost in the ending cutscene of the quest even without a ghostspeak amulet equipped.

RECRUITMENTDRIVE.name: Recruitment Drive
RECRUITMENTDRIVE.description: The Temple Knights of Saradomin, a secret organisation founded many centuries ago by Saradomin himself, are currently looking to expand their ranks with some new blood. After the successful thwarting of the Black Knights' plans to take over Asgarnia, and with the personal recommendation of Sir Amik, you have now been offered the chance to apply for membership in this organization... but are you up to the challenge?
RECRUITMENTDRIVE.startPoint: Talk to [Sir Amik Varze](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Sir_Amik_Varze) in the [White Knights' Castle](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/White_Knights%27_Castle) in [Falador](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Falador).
rewards: Access to [initiate armour](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Initiate_armour). You will be given a [sallet](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Initiate_sallet) for free, and you can buy subsequent sallets for 6,000 GP, the [cuisse](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Initiate_cuisse) for 8,000 coins, the [hauberk](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Initiate_hauberk) for 10,000 coins, or the full set for 20,000 coins. It is aesthetically similar to [white armour](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/White_equipment#Armour), yet has a gold trim.

The Gaze of Saradomin - When you die, you will have the option of returning to [Falador](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Falador) instead of [Lumbridge](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Lumbridge). Talk to [Sir Tiffy Cashien](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Sir_Tiffy_Cashien) to change your spawn point at any time.
If you were a male at the start of the quest, you'll be given your 3,000 coins back, as well as a free [Makeover voucher](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Makeover_voucher) to change back.
requirements: Ability to defeat a level 20 monster without any items at all
trivia: None

ROMEOANDJULIET.name: Romeo & Juliet
ROMEOANDJULIET.description: [Romeo](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Romeo) and [Juliet](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Juliet) are desperately in love, but Juliet's father doesn't approve. Help them to find a way to get married and live happily ever after.
trivia: Romeo & Juliet is one of 6 quests released on the launch day of RuneScape.
If you talk to Juliet again she will seem fed up with Romeo. If you speak to Romeo he has mistaken Juliet's 'death' and has fallen in love with Phillipa.
The Cadava potion may be a pun on the word cadaver, which is a dead body or corpse.

ROVINGELVES.name: Roving Elves
ROVINGELVES.description: Deep in the elven forests of Isafdar, live a duo of roving elves: Islwyn a grumpy, old elf who dislikes humans and his companion, [Eluned](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Eluned), who is a beautiful, friendly, young female elf with a kind heart. In this quest, you are challenged to overcome Islwyn's prejudice against humans and alleviate the burdens of the past.
ROVINGELVES.startPoint: Talk to [Islwyn](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Islwyn) inside the elven woods.
rewards: A used [crystal bow](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Crystal_bow) or [crystal shield](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Crystal_shield) (your choice, it will be 2/10 charged).
requirements: Ability to defeat a level 84 enemy without [runes](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Runes), [weapons](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Weapons), or [armour](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Armour)
trivia: None

ROYALTROUBLE.name: Royal Trouble
ROYALTROUBLE.description: It's tough being a regent of a small island kingdom, especially when the [king](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/King_Vargas) has declared war while you were adventuring. Something is up in [Miscellania](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Miscellania) and [Etceteria](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Etceteria), so you'd better find out what before both kingdoms end up in royal trouble.
ROYALTROUBLE.startPoint: Go to [Miscellania](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Miscellania) and speak to [Advisor Ghrim](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Advisor_Ghrim) in the castle.
requirements: 40 [Agility](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Agility) (or 35 boosted with a [summer pie](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Summer_pie). Note: You will have to pass 4 obstacles; if you are boosting with a summer pie, you will need multiple of them.)
trivia: If the player asks the guard in [Miscellania](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Miscellania) if he or she can go down the dungeon before he or she gets permission to go down there, the guard will say "You're the regent? Well I didn't vote for you!" This is a reference to [Monty Python and the Holy Grail](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monty_Python_and_the_Holy_Grail).
The examine text near the lumberjack is 'He's a lumberjack and he's okay.', another reference to Monty Python.

If the player switches his or her gender between [Throne of Miscellania](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Throne_of_Miscellania) and this quest, various humorous lines such as 'Weren't you a man when we last met?' are said throughout the quest.

'Those Meddling Kids' may be a reference to [Scooby-Doo](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scooby-Doo), in which the antagonist would almost always say 'I would've gotten away with it too, if it weren't for those meddling kids.'
Another Scooby-Doo reference happens later on in the quest when one of the children say 'And we would have gotten away with it too, if it wasn't for that giant snake.'

SHIELDOFARRAV.name: Shield of Arrav
SHIELDOFARRAV.description: Varrockian literature tells of a valuable shield, stolen long ago from the museum of Varrock, by a gang of professional thieves. See if you can track down this shield and return it to the museum. You will need a friend to help you complete this quest.
SHIELDOFARRAV.startPoint: Go to [Miscellania](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Miscellania) and speak to [Advisor Ghrim](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Advisor_Ghrim) in the castle.
trivia: If a player cannot find someone to trade the certificates with, they cannot finish the quest.
If a Phoenix Gang member tries to talk to Katrine, she spits on them and does not allow them to join the gang.
A Black Arm Gang member can enter the Phoenix Gang Weapon Storage with a key from a Phoenix Gang member.

Phoenix crossbows can be obtained by Phoenix gang members by going into the weapon store and telekinetic grabbing them. However, the crossbows must be traded to a Black Arm gang member in order to gain trust to Katrine.

VAMPIRESLAYER.name: Vampire Slayer
VAMPIRESLAYER.description: The people of Draynor Village live in constant terror. Their numbers are dwindling, all due to the foul creature lurking in the manor to the north known as a vampire.
VAMPIRESLAYER.startPoint: Go to [Miscellania](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Miscellania) and speak to [Advisor Ghrim](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Advisor_Ghrim) in the castle.
trivia: None

BONEVOYAGE.name: Bone Voyage
BONEVOYAGE.description: Curator Haig Halen needs your help to finish the construction of a barge fit to take the Varrock museum crew to an unexplored landmass to the east. There have been many attempts to reach the island, but none were successful. This quest will have you venturing across Gielinor, aiding the Varrock museum and making the success of the voyage a possibility.
BONEVOYAGE.startPoint: Go to [Miscellania](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Miscellania) and speak to [Advisor Ghrim](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Advisor_Ghrim) in the castle.
trivia: The name of the quest is a pun on the French bon voyage, used to wish others a safe journey, and bones, since the destination is Fossil Island. The pun made its first appearance in an update news post on 10 April 2006 with the release of Rag and Bone Man.

The term 'Feature Creep' used to describe the second flawed design, refers to a common anti-pattern in software design, where unnecessary features are added to the system. In real life this often results in the failure of the system.

THEFEUD.name: The Feud
THEFEUD.description: Ali Morrisane - RuneScape's self proclaimed 'greatest merchant' - is having difficulties. He is selling things at such a rate that he cannot keep his market stall in stock. Word has it that he is on the lookout for someone; someone who can recruit some help from his home town Pollnivneach - a somewhat anarchic place, south of the Shantay pass.
THEFEUD.startPoint: Go to [Miscellania](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Miscellania) and speak to [Advisor Ghrim](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Advisor_Ghrim) in the castle.
trivia: The combination to the mayor's safe is the first 6 terms of the Fibonacci sequence.
Even though the bandit champion wields a steel scimitar, he will drop an adamant scimitar.
If you decide to go back to the urchin and pay him, you can ask him about various aspects of Pollnivneach, including the gangs, and the town itself.
When you talk to Ali the Barman about Traitorous Ali, you discover there are no toilets in Gielinor.

While completing the quest, your character will realise that the main reason Ali Morrisane sent you to Pollnivneach was so that you would buy a desert disguise from him as well as the camels and hot sauce, thus proving that Ali Morrisane is, in fact, the greatest merchant in all of RuneScape.
Upon completion of the quest Ali Morrisane refers to his nephew as 'Baba', making a reference to Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves.

After talking to the Ali the mayor about the last events, if you go and talk to Ali the bar man, you can tell that the beer was poisoned and he will thank you for not ruining his reputation and give you a beer.

WITCHSPOTION.name: Witch's Potion
WITCHSPOTION.description: Become one with your darker side. Tap into your hidden depths of magical potential by making a potion with the help of Hetty the Rimmington witch.
WITCHSPOTION.startPoint: Go to [Miscellania](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Miscellania) and speak to [Advisor Ghrim](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Advisor_Ghrim) in the castle.
trivia: None

DIGSITE.name: The Dig Site
DIGSITE.description: Feeling uneducated? Desperate for buried treasure? "There's gold in them there hills" (well stream actually) as well as many other items that can be found at the digsite. Join the students in their attempt to be a qualified archaeologist, and become experienced in making the earth move! Have you got what it takes to unearth the hidden altar to one of RuneScape's lesser-known Gods?
DIGSITE.startPoint: Go to [Miscellania](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Miscellania) and speak to [Advisor Ghrim](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Advisor_Ghrim) in the castle.
trivia: The altar room under the digsite is the Altar of Zaros where, in RuneScape 3, you can switch to Ancient Curses after completing The Temple at Senntisten.

RFD.name: Recipe for Disaster
RFD.description: You have protected all 8 members of the council, but your troubles with the Culinaromancer aren't over yet! He has teleported back to his own dimension, where he'll be ready to cause more trouble. You must defeat him for good! Please note that all prayer will not be allowed in the dimension. You also won't be able to go back and recover your items when you die. You can however teleport from the dimension using an ectophial should you run out of food.
RFD.startPoint: After you finish the eight subquests, a white portal will appear in the dining room. Enter it when you're ready to fight.
trivia: When the player is informed of the universe, he exclaims, 'Not the universe! That's where I keep all my stuff.' This is a reference to the animated comedy series [Futurama](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Futurama).
Originally, there was yet another subquest to complete involving [Osman](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Osman), however, due to delays in this subquest, it was not released.

The three monkeys during [Awowogei](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Awowogei)'s part is a reference to the [three wise monkeys](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_wise_monkeys) (さんびきのさる sanbikinosaru), who see no evil, hear no evil, and speak no evil.
Before the release of [Grim Tales](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Grim_Tales), this quest had the highest requirement, with 70 [Cooking](https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Cooking).
Culinomancer shouts "I'LL BE BACK!" after the player has set free all the guests. This is a reference to Arnold Schwarzenegger's famous catch phrase.
